section.name: Market (business) accounting, import data from tax accounting.
section.p:
IRS demands Bob to keep entries (in either single entry or in double entries accounting system) to estimate his taxes in calendar year period. Bob want to estimate his real business results monthly. Market accounting (double entries system) based on rule:
Assets - Liabilities = how much does Bob's business cost (he can sold it) = Owner's equity
section.b:
The most entries from Tax accounting is relevant for Market one. Excluding entries are:
Property deprecation
Closing entries (yearly)
All bad debts entries
Credit inventory capitalized cost entries (yearly).
section.p: Bob create new Beige Accounting Market in same way as Software installation, accounting settings, chart of accounts, started capital. except "Chart of accounts", "Expenses" and "Started capital". He uses c:\beige-accounting-market folder for market accounting. He edit file c:\beige-accounting-market\webapp\WEB-INF\web.xml with Notepad++ to change database ID:

Then he launch market accounting (in beige-accounting-market folder) on port 8080.
He use "menu - about" in tax accounting to know its ID:

If you bought something then you can't sold it for the same price. Bob think that he can sold his Ford right now (in January) for 20000 USD, so he report Ford cost loss:

In opposite to tax accounting Bob want to report loss immediately. Funny coffee shop bad debt is 32.92. But if IRS has approved this bad debt, then Bob's income tax deducting will be roughly 32.92 * 25% = 8.23 (25 is predicted tax rate). So he create new asset account Income Tax Deducting:
Note that ID for account must be a word without spaces maximum 25 letters!
Then Bob transfer 8.23 into it, and the rest into Other loses:
section.h4: Closing of inventory capitalized cost monthly.
section.p: Bob believes that these expenses should not be capitalized (increased assets). Any asset should has current market cost, and it (cost) never depends of "how much does it cost to you". He just transfer their full amount into Other loses account using trial balance:

In February Bob sell pizza for 37000 USD, expenses is 11000 USD. So gross income = 26000 USD, income tax = 6500 USD (Bob earns 19500 in Feb vs 6750 in Jan). Bob closes February with result: his business market cost is 66248.75. But at this time (Feb 29 evening) a reliable businessman call Bob and ask him that he wants to buy Bob's pizza business for 80000 USD. Bob refuse this offer and report this event (increased business cost for 13751.2492) with new asset account Bob's pizza name:
